intro: Lipostoma sericeum, commonly known as the silky leaf liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, softly hairy leaves that give it a silky appearance. This liverwort typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rock crevices or soil banks. Its morphology includes a thallus that is often divided into segmented lobes. Lipostoma sericeum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
